Right? I feel like FNC kind of underestimated Balls and let him have an easy matchup top - they probably thought that Yasuo could outplay and outscale Darius - which would normally be the case (let's be honest: Huni, when he's not tilting or tryharding too much, is one of the best toplaners in the world), but that bit them in their backs once Balls got that double kill in the jungle
Yeah agreed

The problem with that against C9's comp isn't that Darius is getting onto your back line, it's that you have to get on to his.

Sneaky and Incarnati0n are sieging and taking a turret. Fnatic has to either surrender it, or fight C9. If they fight, then Darius can enter the fight freely.
It's not Darius being a god and just roaming around killing people, it's enemy teams being forced to either surrender or fight Darius.

As the analyst said, C9 used Darius perfectly, Darius' one weakness is actually getting to his target, so what do you do? Make them come to him. 

Siege Composition is perfect for Darius and C9's game showed and the final fight showed exactly how Darius should be played and why he's so powerful. Either you sit back and Azir and Tristana is going to mow down all the turrets, or you need to engage then go through the front line that is Darius, either way, good luck with that.

This is literally what i've been saying for years.  A champion is only overpowered if the amount of **effort** required to keep **only that specific champion** at bay, actually **compromises** the amount of effort required to keep the rest of their team at bay.

I generally don't watch LCS, but I've actually watched a few of the worlds as they were pretty entertaining. That though has been the biggest thing I've noticed, was how missused Darius has been. Essentially treating him like Mao, and then wondering why he's doing poorly. My friend was trying to say it's because they know how to play around him, but no it's just they haven't been playing the game with him being a central point of the game.
Already waiting for RIOT to release the "Worlds Pentadunk Darius" skin.

i just think that had been a showcase of fnatic drafting rather horribly....picking a champ that has issues in the 1v1 early on + a comp that has to get close. The Darius made sense in C9s comp, yea - but a really intelligent team would just have fought them with some heavy poke and there wouldn´t have been much C9 could have done with very limited engage.
I think OG and SKT so far showcased best why you should never pick Darius early on if you respect your opponents even a little, his weaknesses are just too easy to abuse.
